subject: Re: [patchmanagement] KB5020276—Netjoin: Domain join hardening changes
email_text_original:
As an aside to this, as far as I can tell, unless the enforcement behavior has
changed it, Domain Admins should not be subject to the restriction. We set
(allowed?) this to be enforced about a year ago and created an exclusion group
for people who regularly need to remove and rejoin computers in AD. 
We are finding that even DAs are not able to reuse a computer object unless a
member of said group. This was experienced just yesterday when a DA attempted to
rejoin a computer which had been removed from the domain. 
02/13/2024 17:21:27:345 NetpCheckIfAccountShouldBeReused: Account re-use attempt
was Denied by Active Directory Policy.
02/13/2024 17:21:27:345 NetpCheckIfAccountShouldBeReused:fReuseAllowed: FALSE,
NetStatus:0x0
02/13/2024 17:21:27:345 NetpModifyComputerObjectInDs: Account exists and re-use
is blocked by policy. Error: 0xaac
02/13/2024 17:21:27:345 NetpProvisionComputerAccount: LDAP creation failed:
0xaac
02/13/2024 17:21:27:345 ldap_unbind status: 0x0
02/13/2024 17:21:27:345 NetpJoinCreatePackagePart: status:0xaac.
02/13/2024 17:21:27:345 NetpJoinDomainOnDs: Function exits with status of: 0xaac 
On Wed, Feb 14, 2024 at 3:41 AM Abbodii <abbodi86@gmail.com
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/CAEuHzznO10iwg%3DN%3DMi8A%3DY5Cacs8GB1CB2E9ECkeky5PpJPHJg%40mail.gmail.com
